definition: to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: There have been many proposals, but all share two features.
sentences.chinese: 提案已然數不勝數，但總歸有兩個共同點。

sentences.english: No love is always the wind, hold thousands of times will go.
sentences.chinese: 得不到的愛人總歸是風，強留千百次也終究會走。

sentences.english: The food will be horrible, as it always is for astronauts.
sentences.chinese: 食物可能也比較糟糕，因爲總歸是爲宇航員準備的。

sentences.english: Sometimes they are hard solutions, but they always have a solution.
sentences.chinese: 有時它們很難解決，但總歸有解決方案。

sentences.english: The object of curious dent disorderly total being, can not mention the letter always returns not is reserve at a polite distance.
sentences.chinese: 怪力亂神的東西，不能說不信，總歸是敬而遠之。

sentences.english: We will always shake hands and past.
sentences.chinese: 我們總歸都會和過往握手言和。

sentences.english: But look closer. There is always a payoff.
sentences.chinese: 但是請仔細想想，回報總歸是有的。

sentences.english: Besides, girls aren't going to like you for awhile anyway.
sentences.chinese: 另外，女孩子們在那時候總歸不會喜歡你的。

sentences.english: Sailors being sailors, they like to push the boat as much as they can.
sentences.chinese: 水手總歸是水手，他們喜歡讓船航行得儘可能遠些。

sentences.english: The answer is always going to be zero.
The fledglings are always small potatoes.
